501(c)(3) Nonprofit | Nonpartisan | San Diego to Washington DC | Ethics-First

What We Do

Our work takes three forms: speaker series, fellowships, and strategic convenings that bridge sectors and deliver measurable outcomes.

Public/Private Engagements

Speaker Series

Candid discussions with senior leaders in government, defense, tech, and industry. Built for actionable insights, not surface-level commentary.

Learn more →

Fellowship

National Security Fellowship

Two-way placement between government and industry professionals to foster trust, share expertise, and align on mission-critical technology and policy.

Learn more →

Veteran Mentoring

Veteran Mentoring

A veterans-focused program that pairs operational experience with executive mentorship. Start by building your resume on Operation MOS, then connect with industry leaders for guidance.

Learn more →
View all programs
Insights & Perspectives

Briefings

Actionable writing on national security, ethics, and cross-sector execution.

Featured Briefing | veterans

Why I Built Operation MOS: The Resume Industry Is Failing Veterans (And We're Fixing It)

60% of veterans are underemployed in their first year of separation. Not because they're not qualified. because the career transition industry is teaching advice that worked in 1995 but gets them rejected in 2026.

Why it matters: This analysis provides critical context for understanding cross-sector dynamics.

Andrew Shea
Senior Advisor
January 6 · 5 min read Read briefing →
